   20: -module(code_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   26: -export([set_path/1, get_path/1, add_path/1, add_paths/1, del_path/1,
   27: 	 replace_path/1, load_file/1, load_abs/1,
   28:          ensure_loaded/1, ensure_loaded_many/1, ensure_loaded_many_kill/1,
   29:          ensure_loaded_bad_case/1,
   30: 	 delete/1, purge/1, purge_many_exits/0, purge_many_exits/1,
   31:          soft_purge/1, is_loaded/1, all_loaded/1,
   32: 	 load_binary/1, dir_req/1, object_code/1, set_path_file/1,
   33: 	 upgrade/0, upgrade/1,
   34: 	 sticky_dir/1, add_del_path/1,
   35:          pa_pz_option/1, remove_pa_pz_option/1,
   36: 	 dir_disappeared/1, ext_mod_dep/1, clash/1,
   37: 	 where_is_file/1,
   38: 	 purge_stacktrace/1, mult_lib_roots/1, bad_erl_libs/1,
   39: 	 on_load/1,
   40:          on_load_binary/1, on_load_binary_twice/1,
   41: 	 on_load_embedded/1, on_load_errors/1, on_load_update/1,
   42:          on_load_trace_on_load/1,
   43: 	 on_load_purge/1, on_load_self_call/1, on_load_pending/1,
   44: 	 on_load_deleted/1, on_load_deadlock/1,
   45:          on_load_deadlock_load_binary_GH7466/1, on_load_deadlock_ensure_loaded_GH7466/1,
   46: 	 big_boot_embedded/1,
   47:          module_status/1,
   48: 	 get_mode/1, code_path_cache/1,
   49: 	 normalized_paths/1, mult_embedded_flags/1]).
   50: 
   51: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   52: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   53: 
   54: %% error_logger
   55: -export([init/1,
   56: 	 handle_event/2, handle_call/2, handle_info/2,
   57: 	 terminate/2]).
   58: 
   59: -export([compile_load/4]).
   60: 
   61: suite() ->
   62:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   63:      {timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   64: 
   65: all() ->
   66:     [set_path, get_path, add_path, add_paths, del_path,
   67:      replace_path, load_file, load_abs,
   68:      ensure_loaded, ensure_loaded_many, ensure_loaded_many_kill,
   69:      ensure_loaded_bad_case,
   70:      delete, purge, purge_many_exits, soft_purge, is_loaded, all_loaded,
   71:      load_binary, dir_req, object_code, set_path_file,
   72:      upgrade, code_path_cache,
   73:      pa_pz_option, remove_pa_pz_option,
   74:      sticky_dir, add_del_path, dir_disappeared,
   75:      ext_mod_dep, clash, where_is_file,
   76:      purge_stacktrace, mult_lib_roots,
   77:      bad_erl_libs, on_load,
   78:      on_load_binary, on_load_binary_twice,
   79:      on_load_embedded, on_load_errors,
   80:      {group, sequence},
   81:      on_load_purge, on_load_self_call, on_load_pending,
   82:      on_load_deleted, on_load_deadlock, on_load_deadlock_load_binary_GH7466,
   83:      on_load_deadlock_ensure_loaded_GH7466,
   84:      module_status,
   85:      big_boot_embedded, get_mode, normalized_paths,
   86:      mult_embedded_flags].
   87: 
   88: %% These need to run in order
   89: groups() -> [{sequence, [sequence], [on_load_update,
   90:                                      on_load_trace_on_load]}].
   91: 
   92: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   93: 	Config.
   94: 
   95: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   96: 	Config.
   97: 
   98: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   99:     %% The compiler will no longer create a Beam file if
  100:     %% the module name does not match the filename, so
  101:     %% we must compile to a binary and write the Beam file
  102:     %% ourselves.
  103:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  104:     File = filename:join(Dir, "code_a_test"),
  105:     {ok,code_b_test,Code} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  106:     ok = file:write_file(File++".beam", Code),
  107:     Config.
  108: 
  109: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  110:     Config.
  111: 
  112: -define(TESTMOD, test_dummy).
  113: -define(TESTMODSTR, "test_dummy").
  114: -define(TESTMODSRC, ?TESTMODSTR ".erl").
  115: -define(TESTMODOBJ, ?TESTMODSTR ".beam").
  116: 
  117: init_per_testcase(big_boot_embedded, Config) ->
  118:     case catch application:start(crypto) of
  119: 	ok ->
  120: 	    init_per_testcase(do_big_boot_embedded, Config);
  121: 	_Else ->
  122: 	    {skip, "Needs crypto!"}
  123:     end;
  124: init_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config0) ->
  125:     LibRoot = code:lib_dir(),
  126:     LinkName = filename:join(LibRoot, "on_load_app-1.0"),
  127:     Config = [{link_name,LinkName}|Config0],
  128:     init_per_testcase(Config);
  129: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  130:     init_per_testcase(Config).
  131: 
  132: init_per_testcase(Config) ->
  133:     P = code:get_path(),
  134:     [{code_path, P}|Config].
  135: 
  136: 
  137: end_per_testcase(module_status, Config) ->
  138:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  139:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  140:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  141:     file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ),
  142:     file:delete(?TESTMODSRC),
  143:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  144: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == mult_lib_roots;
  145: 				  TC == big_boot_embedded ->
  146:     {ok, HostName} = inet:gethostname(),
  147:     NodeName = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(TC)++"@"++HostName),
  148:     test_server:stop_node(NodeName),
  149:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  150: end_per_testcase(on_load_embedded, Config) ->
  151:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
  152:     _ = del_link(LinkName),
  153:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  154: end_per_testcase(upgrade, Config) ->
  155:     %% Make sure tracing is turned off even if the test times out.
  156:     erlang:trace_pattern({error_handler,undefined_function,3}, false, [global]),
  157:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
  158:     end_per_testcase(Config);
  159: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  160:     end_per_testcase(Config).
  161: 
  162: end_per_testcase(Config) ->
  163:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  164:     P=proplists:get_value(code_path, Config),
  165:     true=code:set_path(P),
  166:     P=code:get_path(),
  167:     ok.
  168: 
  169: set_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  170:     P = code:get_path(),
  171:     NonExDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), test_server:temp_name("hej")),
  172:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:set_path({a})),
  173:     {error, bad_directory} = (catch code:set_path([{a}])),
  174:     {error, bad_directory} = code:set_path(NonExDir),
  175:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  176:     true = code:set_path(P), % set the same path again.
  177:     P = code:get_path(), % still the same path.
  178:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  179:     true = code:set_path([LibDir | P]),
  180:     [LibDir | P] = code:get_path(),
  181:     true = code:set_path([LibDir]),
  182:     [LibDir] = code:get_path(),
  183:     ok.
  184: 
  185: get_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  186:     P = code:get_path(),
  187:     %% test that all directories are strings (lists).
  188:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  189: 	    (Dir) when is_list(Dir) -> false;
  190: 	    (_) -> true
  191: 	end, P),
  192:     ok.
  193: 
  194: add_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  195:     P = code:get_path(),
  196:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_path({})),
  197:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_patha({})),
  198:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:add_pathz({})),
  199:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_path("xyz"),
  200:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_patha("xyz"),
  201:     {error, bad_directory} = code:add_pathz("xyz"),
  202:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  203:     true = code:add_path(LibDir),
  204:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  205:     code:set_path(P),
  206:     true = code:add_pathz(LibDir),
  207:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  208:     code:set_path(P),
  209:     true = code:add_patha(LibDir),
  210:     [LibDir|_] = code:get_path(),
  211:     code:set_path(P),
  212:     ok.
  213: 
  214: add_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  215:     P = code:get_path(),
  216:     ok = code:add_paths([{}]),
  217:     ok = code:add_pathsa([{}]),
  218:     ok = code:add_pathsz([{}]),
  219:     ok = code:add_paths(["xyz"]),
  220:     ok = code:add_pathsa(["xyz"]),
  221:     ok = code:add_pathsz(["xyz"]),
  222:     P = code:get_path(), % check that no directory is added.
  223: 
  224:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  225:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir]),
  226:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  227:     code:set_path(P),
  228:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir]),
  229:     LibDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  230:     code:set_path(P),
  231:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir]),
  232:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  233:     code:set_path(P),
  234: 
  235:     RootDir = code:root_dir(),
  236:     Res = P ++ [LibDir, RootDir],
  237:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, RootDir]),
  238:     Res = code:get_path(),
  239:     code:set_path(P),
  240:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, RootDir]),
  241:     Res = code:get_path(),
  242:     code:set_path(P),
  243:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, RootDir]),
  244:     [RootDir, LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  245:     code:set_path(P),
  246: 
  247:     ok = code:add_paths([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  248:     Res1 = P ++ [LibDir],
  249:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  250:     code:set_path(P),
  251:     ok = code:add_pathsz([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  252:     Res1 = code:get_path(),
  253:     code:set_path(P),
  254:     ok = code:add_pathsa([LibDir, "xyz"]),
  255:     [LibDir|P] = code:get_path(),
  256:     code:set_path(P),
  257:     ok.
  258: 
  259: del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  260:     P = code:get_path(),
  261:     try
  262: 	del_path_1(P)
  263:     after
  264: 	code:set_path(P)
  265:     end.
  266: 
  267: del_path_1(P) ->
  268:     io:format("Initial code:get_path()=~p~n",[P]),
  269:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:del_path(3)),
  270:     false = code:del_path(my_dummy_name),
  271:     false = code:del_path("/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  272:     Dir = filename:join([code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin"]),
  273:     io:format("kernel dir: ~p~n",[Dir]),
  274: 
  275:     true = code:del_path(kernel),
  276:     NewP = code:get_path(),
  277:     io:format("Path after removing 'kernel':~p~n",[NewP]),
  278:     ReferenceP = lists:delete(Dir,P),
  279:     io:format("Reference path:~p~n",[ReferenceP]),
  280:     NewP = ReferenceP, % check that dir is deleted
  281:     code:set_path(P),
  282: 
  283:     %% An superfluous "/" should also work.
  284:     true = code:del_path("kernel/"),
  285:     NewP = ReferenceP,			   % check that dir is deleted
  286:     code:set_path(P),
  287: 
  288:     true = code:del_path(Dir),
  289:     NewP1 = code:get_path(),
  290:     NewP1 = lists:delete(Dir,P), % check that dir is deleted
  291:     ok.
  292: 
  293: replace_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  294:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  295:     P = code:get_path(),
  296:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:replace_path(3,"")),
  297:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(dummy_name,""),
  298:     {error, bad_name} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  299: 						"/kdlk/my_dummy_dir"),
  300:     {error, bad_directory} = code:replace_path(kernel,
  301: 						     "/kdlk/kernel-1.2"),
  302:     P = code:get_path(), % Check that path is not changed.
  303: 
  304:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  305: 
  306:     %% Replace an existing application.
  307: 
  308:     file:make_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  309:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  310:     NewDir = Cwd ++ "/kernel-2.11",
  311:     true = code:replace_path(kernel, NewDir),
  312:     NewDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  313:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  314:     ok = file:del_dir("./kernel-2.11"),
  315: 
  316:     %% Add a completely new application.
  317: 
  318:     NewAppName = 'blurf_blarfer',
  319:     NewAppDir = filename:join(Cwd, atom_to_list(NewAppName) ++ "-6.33.1"),
  320:     ok = file:make_dir(NewAppDir),
  321:     true = code:replace_path(NewAppName, NewAppDir),
  322:     NewAppDir = code:lib_dir(NewAppName),
  323:     NewAppDir = lists:last(code:get_path()),
  324:     true = code:set_path(P),			%Reset path
  325:     ok = file:del_dir(NewAppDir),
  326: 
  327:     ok.
  328: 
  329: code_path_cache(Config) ->
  330:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  331: 
  332:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
  333:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
  334:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
  335:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
  336: 
  337:     Original = code:get_path(),
  338:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "myebin"),
  339:     filelib:ensure_path(Dir),
  340:     ToBeReplacedDir1 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-1/ebin"),
  341:     ToBeReplacedDir2 = filename:join(PrivDir, "tobereplaced-2/ebin"),
  342:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  343:     filelib:ensure_path(ToBeReplacedDir2),
  344: 
  345:     File = filename:join(Dir, ?TESTMODOBJ),
  346:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
  347: 
  348:     %% Adding a cached path and re-adding for clearing
  349:     [begin
  350:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  351:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  352:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  353:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  354:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  355:         true = code:Fun(Dir, cache),
  356:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  357:         code:del_path(Dir),
  358:         ok = file:delete(File)
  359:      end || Fun <- [add_path, add_patha, add_pathz]],
  360: 
  361:     Original = code:get_path(),
  362: 
  363:     %% Adding several cached paths and explicit cache clearing
  364:     [begin
  365:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  366:         ok = code:Fun([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1], cache),
  367:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  368:         ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  369:         error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  370:         ok = code:clear_cache(),
  371:         {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  372:         ok = code:del_paths([Dir, ToBeReplacedDir1]),
  373:         ok = file:delete(File)
  374:      end || Fun <- [add_paths, add_pathsa, add_pathsz]],
  375: 
  376:     Original = code:get_path(),
  377: 
  378:     %% Replacing a non-cached path with cache and set_path for clearing
  379:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  380:     true = code:add_path(ToBeReplacedDir1),
  381:     true = code:replace_path(tobereplaced, ToBeReplacedDir2, cache),
  382:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  383:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(ToBeReplacedDir2, ?TESTMODOBJ), Bin),
  384:     error = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  385:     true = code:set_path(code:get_path(), nocache),
  386:     {_,_,_} = code:get_object_code(?TESTMOD),
  387: 
  388:     true = code:set_path(Original),
  389:     ok.
  390: 
  391: %% OTP-3977.
  392: dir_disappeared(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  393:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  394:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "temp"),
  395:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  396:     true = code:add_path(Dir),
  397:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  398:     non_existing = code:which(bubbelskrammel),
  399:     ok.
  400: 
  401: load_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  402:     {error, nofile} = code:load_file(duuuumy_mod),
  403:     {error, badfile} = code:load_file(code_a_test),
  404:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_file(123)),
  405:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  406:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  407:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  408:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_file(code_b_test),
  409:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  410:     ok.
  411: 
  412: test_dir() ->
  413:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
  414: 
  415: load_abs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  416:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  417:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/duuuumy_mod"),
  418:     {error, badfile} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_a_test"),
  419:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:load_abs({})),
  420:     {error, nofile} = code:load_abs("Non-latin-имя-файла"),
  421:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  422:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  423:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  424:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  425:     ok.
  426: 
  427: ensure_loaded_bad_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  428:     %% Make sure loading an invalid .beam file does
  429:     %% not hold a permanent lock on the server.
  430:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  431:     {error, _} = code:ensure_loaded('STRING'),
  432:     ok.
  433: 
  434: ensure_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  435:     {module, lists} = code:ensure_loaded(lists),
  436:     case init:get_argument(mode) of
  437: 	{ok, [["embedded"] | _]} ->
  438: 	    {error, embedded} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  439: 	    {error, badarg} = code:ensure_loaded(34),
  440: 	    ok;
  441: 	_ ->
  442: 	    {error, nofile} = code:ensure_loaded(duuuumy_mod),
  443: 	    {error, badfile} = code:ensure_loaded(code_a_test),
  444: 	    {'EXIT', _} = (catch code:ensure_loaded(34)),
  445: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  446: 	    {module, code_b_test} = code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test),
  447: 	    ok
  448:     end.
  449: 
  450: ensure_loaded_many(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  451:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  452:         %% Without special handling for async loading in code server,
  453:         %% this operation seemed to consistently take 5s+
  454:         Action = fun() ->
  455:             Self = self(),
  456:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  457:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  458:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  459:             ok
  460:         end,
  461:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []], 1_000)
  462:     end).
  463: 
  464: ensure_loaded_many_kill(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  465:     with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, fun(Node) ->
  466:         Action = fun() ->
  467:             Self = self(),
  468:             Fun = fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(code_b_test), Self ! {done, self()} end,
  469:             sys:suspend(code_server),
  470:             First = spawn_opt(Fun, [{priority, max}]),
  471:             Pids = [spawn(Fun) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 1_000)],
  472:             sys:resume(code_server),
  473:             exit(First, kill),
  474:             [receive {done, Pid} -> ok end || Pid <- Pids],
  475:             {file, _} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  476:             ok
  477:         end,
  478:         ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Action, []])
  479:     end).
  480: 
  481: with_large_loadpath_peer(Config, Fun) ->
  482:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  483:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  484:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun set_up_large_loadpath/1, [Priv]]),
  485:     try Fun(Node)
  486:     after peer:stop(Peer)
  487:     end.
  488: 
  489: set_up_large_loadpath(Priv) ->
  490:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  491:     Dirs = [filename:join(Priv, integer_to_list(N)) || N <- lists:seq(1, 500)],
  492:     [ok = filelib:ensure_path(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  493:     [true = code:add_patha(Dir) || Dir <- Dirs],
  494:     ok.
  495: 
  496: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  497:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  498:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  499:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  500:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  501:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:delete(122)),
  502:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  503:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  504:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  505:     exit(Pid,kill),
  506:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  507:     false = code:delete(code_b_test),
  508:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  509:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  510:     ok.
  511: 
  512: purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  513:     run_purge_test(fun purge_test/1, Config).
  514: 
  515: purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  516:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  517:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  518:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  519:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  520:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  521:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  522:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  523:     true = code:purge(code_b_test),
  524:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  525:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  526:     ok.
  527: 
  528: purge_many_exits() ->
  529:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
  530: 
  531: purge_many_exits(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  532:     run_purge_test(fun purge_many_exits_test/1, Config).
  533: 
  534: purge_many_exits_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  535:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  536: 
  537:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  538:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:purge({})),
  539: 
  540:     CodePurgeF = fun(M, Exp) -> Exp = code:purge(M) end,
  541:     purge_many_exits_do(CodePurgeF),
  542: 
  543:     %% Let's repeat test for erlang:purge_module as it does the same thing
  544:     %% now in erts-8.0 (except for return value).
  545:     ErlangPurgeF = fun(M, _Exp) -> erlang:purge_module(M) end,
  546:     purge_many_exits_do(ErlangPurgeF),
  547: 
  548:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  549:     ok.
  550: 
  551: 
  552: purge_many_exits_do(PurgeF) ->
  553:     false = code:purge(code_b_test),
  554:     TPids = lists:map(fun (_) ->
  555: 			      {code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  556: 			       spawn_link(fun () ->
  557: 						  receive
  558: 						  after infinity -> ok
  559: 						  end
  560: 					  end)}
  561: 			 end,
  562: 			 lists:seq(1, 1000)),
  563:     %% Give them time to start...
  564:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  565:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  566:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  567: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  568: 			  false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  569: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2)
  570: 		  end, TPids),
  571:     PurgeF(code_b_test, true),
  572:     lists:foreach(fun ({Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  573: 			  false = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid1),
  574: 			  true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid1),
  575: 			  true = erlang:is_process_alive(Pid2),
  576: 			  exit(Pid2, kill)
  577: 		  end, TPids),
  578:     lists:foreach(fun ({_Pid1, Pid2}) ->
  579: 			  receive {'EXIT', Pid2, _} -> ok end
  580: 		  end, TPids).
  581: 
  582: 
  583: soft_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  584:     run_purge_test(fun soft_purge_test/1, Config).
  585: 
  586: soft_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  587:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  588:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  589:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:soft_purge(23)),
  590:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  591:     Pid = code_b_test:do_spawn(),
  592:     true = code:delete(code_b_test),
  593:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  594:     false = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  595:     false = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  596:     exit(Pid,kill),
  597:     true = code_b_test:check_exit(Pid),
  598:     true = code:soft_purge(code_b_test),
  599:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  600:     ok.
  601: 
  602: is_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  603:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  604:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  605:     false = code:is_loaded(duuuuuumy_mod),
  606:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:is_loaded(23)),
  607:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(init),
  608:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  609:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  610:     {file, _Loaded} = code:is_loaded(code_b_test),
  611:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  612:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  613:     ok.
  614: 
  615: all_loaded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  616:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  617: 	true -> {skip,"Cover is running"};
  618: 	false -> all_loaded_1()
  619:     end.
  620: 
  621: all_loaded_1() ->
  622:     Preloaded = [{M,preloaded} || M <- lists:sort(erlang:pre_loaded())],
  623: 
  624:     Loaded0 = lists:sort(code:all_loaded()),
  625:     all_unique(Loaded0),
  626:     Loaded1 = lists:keysort(2, Loaded0),
  627:     Loaded2 = match_and_remove(Preloaded, Loaded1),
  628: 
  629:     ObjExt = code:objfile_extension(),
  630:     [] = lists:filter(fun
  631: 	    ({Mod,AbsName}) when is_atom(Mod), is_list(AbsName) ->
  632: 		Mod =/= list_to_atom(filename:basename(AbsName, ObjExt));
  633: 	    (_) -> true
  634: 	end, Loaded2),
  635:     ok.
  636: 
  637: match_and_remove([], List) -> List;
  638: match_and_remove([X|T1], [X|T2]) -> match_and_remove(T1, T2).
  639: 
  640: all_unique([]) -> ok;
  641: all_unique([_]) -> ok;
  642: all_unique([{X,_}|[{Y,_}|_]=T]) when X < Y -> all_unique(T).
  643: 
  644: load_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  645:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  646:     File = TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  647:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  648:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(12, File, Bin)),
  649:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, 12, Bin)),
  650:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, 12)),
  651:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  652:     code:stick_dir(TestDir),
  653:     {error, sticky_directory} = code:load_binary(code_b_test, File, Bin),
  654:     code:unstick_dir(TestDir),
  655:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  656:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  657:     ok.
  658: 
  659: 
  660: upgrade() ->
  661:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
  662: 
  663: upgrade(Config) ->
  664:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  665:     upgrade_do(DataDir, beam, [beam]),
  666:     ok.
  667: 
  668: upgrade_do(DataDir, Client, T) ->
  669:     compile_load(upgrade_client, DataDir, undefined, Client),
  670:     [upgrade_client:run(DataDir, U1, U2, O1, O2)
  671:      || U1<-T, U2<-T, O1<-T, O2<-T],
  672:     ok.
  673: 
  674: compile_load(Mod, Dir, Ver, CodeType) ->
  675:     %%erlang:display({"{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{{Loading",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  676:     Version = case Ver of
  677: 	undefined ->
  678: 	    io:format("Compiling '~p' as ~p\n", [Mod, CodeType]),
  679: 	    [];
  680: 	_ ->
  681: 	    io:format("Compiling version ~p of '~p' as ~p\n",
  682: 		[Ver, Mod, CodeType]),
  683: 	    [{d,list_to_atom("VERSION_" ++ integer_to_list(Ver))}]
  684:     end,
  685: 
  686:     CompOpts = [binary, report] ++ Version,
  687: 
  688:     Src = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  689:     T1 = erlang:now(),
  690:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(Src, CompOpts),
  691:     T2 = erlang:now(),
  692:     ObjFile = filename:basename(Src,".erl") ++ ".beam",
  693:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, ObjFile, Code),
  694:     T3 = erlang:now(),
  695:     io:format("Compile time ~p ms, Load time ~p ms\n",
  696: 	      [timer:now_diff(T2,T1) div 1000, timer:now_diff(T3,T2) div 1000]),
  697:     %%erlang:display({"}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}Loaded",Mod,Ver,CodeType}),
  698:     ok.
  699: 
  700: dir_req(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  701:     {ok,[[Root0]]} = init:get_argument(root),
  702:     Root = filename:join([Root0]),	% Normalised form.
  703:     Root = code:root_dir(),
  704:     LibDir = Root ++ "/lib",
  705:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  706:     code:compiler_dir(),
  707:     {error, bad_name} = code:lib_dir(duuumy),
  708:     KernLib = code:lib_dir(kernel),
  709:     Priv = KernLib ++ "/priv",
  710:     Priv = code:priv_dir(kernel),
  711:     {error, bad_name} = code:priv_dir(duuumy),
  712:     ok.
  713: 
  714: object_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  715:     TestDir = test_dir(),
  716:     P = code:get_path(),
  717:     P = code:get_path(),
  718:     code:add_path(TestDir),
  719:     {module, code_b_test} = code:load_abs(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test"),
  720:     LoadedFile = filename:absname(TestDir ++ "/code_b_test" ++
  721: 				  code:objfile_extension()),
  722:     case code:get_object_code(code_b_test) of
  723: 	      {code_b_test,Bin,LoadedFile} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  724: 		  ok
  725: 	  end,
  726:     code:purge(code_b_test),
  727:     code:delete(code_b_test),
  728:     error = code:get_object_code(dddddddduuuuuuumy),
  729:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch code:get_object_code(23)),
  730:     code:set_path(P),
  731:     P=code:get_path(),
  732:     ok.
  733: 
  734: %% Test that set_path does not accept
  735: %% files as pathnames (known previous bug)
  736: set_path_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  737:     File=filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "testfil"),
  738:     ok=file:write_file(File, list_to_binary("lite data")),
  739:     {error, bad_directory}=code:set_path([File]).
  740: 
  741: %% Test that a module with the same name as a module in
  742: %% a sticky directory cannot be loaded.
  743: sticky_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  744:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  745:     Mods = [code,lists,erlang,init],
  746:     OutDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), sticky_dir),
  747:     _ = file:make_dir(OutDir),
  748:     Ret = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply,
  749: 		   [fun sticky_compiler/2,[Mods,OutDir]]),
  750:     case Ret of
  751: 	[] ->
  752: 	    ok;
  753: 	Other ->
  754: 	    io:format("~p\n", [Other]),
  755: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  756:     end,
  757:     peer:stop(Peer),
  758:     ok.
  759: 
  760: sticky_compiler(Files, PrivDir) ->
  761:     code:add_patha(PrivDir),
  762:     Rets = [do_sticky_compile(F, PrivDir) || F <- Files],
  763:     [R || R <- Rets, R =/= ok].
  764: 
  765: do_sticky_compile(Mod, Dir) ->
  766:     case code:is_sticky(Mod) of
  767:         true ->
  768:             %% Make sure that the module is loaded. A module being sticky
  769:             %% only prevents it from begin reloaded, not from being loaded
  770:             %% from the wrong place to begin with.
  771:             Mod = Mod:module_info(module),
  772:             File = filename:append(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod)),
  773:             Src = io_lib:format("-module(~s).\n"
  774:                                 "-export([test/1]).\n"
  775:                                 "test(me) -> fail.\n", [Mod]),
  776:             ok = file:write_file(File++".erl", Src),
  777:             case c:c(File, [{outdir,Dir}]) of
  778:                 {ok,Module} ->
  779:                     Module:test(me);
  780:                 {error,sticky_directory} ->
  781:                     ok
  782:             end;
  783:         false ->
  784:             %% For some reason the module is not sticky
  785:             %% could be that the .erlang file has
  786:             %% unstuck it?
  787:             {Mod, is_not_sticky}
  788:     end.
  789: 
  790: %% Test that the -pa and -pz options work as expected.
  791: pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  792:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  793:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"pa"),
  794:     PzDir = filename:join(DDir,"pz"),
  795:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  796:     Ret=rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
  797:     [PaDir|Paths] = Ret,
  798:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths),
  799:     peer:stop(Peer),
  800:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-pa",
  801:         PaDir, "-pz", PzDir]),
  802:     Ret2=rpc:call(Node2, code, get_path, []),
  803:     [PaDir|Paths2] = Ret2,
  804:     [PzDir|_] = lists:reverse(Paths2),
  805:     peer:stop(Peer2).
  806: 
  807: %% Test that we can remove paths added via -pa and -pz.
  808: remove_pa_pz_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  809:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  810:     PaDir = filename:join(DDir,"clash/foobar-0.1/ebin"),
  811:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-pa", PaDir]),
  812:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [blarg]),
  813:     true = rpc:call(Node, code, del_path, [PaDir]),
  814:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [blarg]),
  815:     peer:stop(Peer).
  816: 
  817: %% add_path, del_path should not cause priv_dir(App) to fail.
  818: add_del_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  819:     DDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config),
  820:     Dir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/ebin"),
  821:     Dir2 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-2.0/ebin"),
  822:     code:add_patha(Dir1),
  823:     PrivDir1 = filename:join(DDir,"dummy_app-1.0/priv"),
  824:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  825:     code:add_path(Dir2), % put last in path
  826:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  827:     code:del_path(Dir2),
  828:     PrivDir1 = code:priv_dir(dummy_app),
  829:     ok.
  830: 
  831: clash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  832:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  833:     DDir = filename:join(DataDir, "clash"),
  834:     P = code:get_path(),
  835: 
  836:     %% test non-clashing entries
  837: 
  838:     true = code:add_path(filename:join(DDir, "foobar-0.1/ebin")),
  839:     true = code:add_path(filename:join(DDir, "zork-0.8/ebin")),
  840:     ct:capture_start(),
  841:     ok = code:clash(),
  842:     ct:capture_stop(),
  843:     [OKMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  844:     true = lists:prefix("** Found 0 name clashes", OKMsg),
  845:     true = code:set_path(P),
  846: 
  847:     %% test clashing entries
  848: 
  849:     true = code:add_path(filename:join(DDir, "zork-0.8/ebin")),
  850:     true = code:add_path(filename:join(DDir, "frotz-0.5/ebin")),
  851:     ct:capture_start(),
  852:     ok = code:clash(),
  853:     ct:capture_stop(),
  854:     [ClashMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  855:     {match, [" hides "]} = re:run(ClashMsg, "\\*\\* .*( hides ).*",
  856:                                   [{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  857:     true = code:set_path(P),
  858: 
  859:     %% test "Bad path can't read"
  860: 
  861:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  862:     PrivDirEbin = filename:join(Priv, "ebin"),
  863:     ok = file:make_dir(PrivDirEbin),
  864:     true = code:add_path(PrivDirEbin),
  865:     ok = file:del_dir(PrivDirEbin),
  866:     ct:capture_start(),
  867:     ok = code:clash(),
  868:     ct:capture_stop(),
  869:     [BadPathMsg|_] = ct:capture_get(),
  870:     true = lists:prefix("** Bad path can't read", BadPathMsg),
  871:     true = code:set_path(P),
  872: 
  873:     ok.
  874: 
  875: %% Every module that the code_server uses should be preloaded,
  876: %% this test case verifies that.
  877: ext_mod_dep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  878:     xref:start(s),
  879:     xref:set_default(s, [{verbose,false},{warnings,false},
  880: 			 {builtins,true},{recurse,true}]),
  881:     xref:set_library_path(s, code:get_path()),
  882:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(kernel),"ebin")),
  883:     xref:add_directory(s, filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib),"ebin")),
  884:     case catch ext_mod_dep2() of
  885: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
  886: 	    xref:stop(s),
  887: 	    exit(Reason);
  888: 	Else ->
  889:     	    xref:stop(s),
  890: 	    case Else of
  891: 		ok -> ok;
  892: 		_ -> ct:fail(Else)
  893: 	    end
  894:     end.
  895: 
  896: ext_mod_dep2() ->
  897:     Exports0 = code_server:module_info(exports) --
  898: 	[{module_info,0},{module_info,1}],
  899:     Exports = [{code_server,M,A} || {M,A} <- Exports0],
  900:     case analyse(Exports, [], [], 0) of
  901: 	{_Visited,0} ->
  902: 	    ok;
  903: 	{_Visited,ErrCnt} ->
  904: 	    {not_verified,ErrCnt}
  905:     end.
  906: 
  907: analyse([], [], Visited, ErrCnt) ->
  908:     {Visited,ErrCnt};
  909: analyse([], [This={M,F,A}|Path], Visited, ErrCnt0) ->
  910:     %% The code_server has been granted to use the following modules,
  911:     %% These modules should be loaded by code.erl before
  912:     %% the code_server is started.
  913:     OK = [erlang, os, prim_file, erl_prim_loader, init, ets,
  914: 	  code_server, lists, lists_sort, unicode, binary, filename,
  915: 	  gb_sets, gb_trees, erts_code_purger, erts_internal, code,
  916: 	  zlib],
  917:     ErrCnt1 =
  918: 	case lists:member(M, OK) or erlang:is_builtin(M,F,A) of
  919: 	    true ->
  920: 		0;
  921: 	    false ->
  922: 		check_funs(This, Path)
  923: 	end,
  924:     {Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0};
  925: analyse([MFA|R], Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0) ->
  926:     case lists:member(MFA,Visited0) of
  927: 	false ->
  928: 	    {Visited,ErrCnt1} = analyse2(MFA, Path, Visited0),
  929: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited, ErrCnt1+ErrCnt0);
  930: 	true ->
  931: 	    analyse(R, Path, Visited0, ErrCnt0)
  932:     end.
  933: 
  934: analyse2(MFA = {'$M_EXPR',_, _}, Path, Visited0) ->
  935:     analyse([], [MFA|Path], Visited0, 0);
  936: analyse2(MFA={_,_,_}, Path, Visited0) ->
  937:     {ok, FL} = xref:analyze(s,{call,MFA}),
  938:     analyse(FL, [MFA|Path], my_usort([MFA|Visited0]), 0).
  939: 
  940: %%%% We need to check these manually...
  941: %% fun's are ok as long as they are defined locally.
  942: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  943: 	   [{unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  944: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  945: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  946: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  947: 	   [{unicode,ml_map,3},
  948: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  949: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  950: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  951: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  952: 	   [{unicode,do_o_binary2,2},
  953: 	    {unicode,do_o_binary,2},
  954: 	    {unicode,o_trans,1},
  955: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary_int,3},
  956: 	    {unicode,characters_to_binary,3},
  957: 	    {filename,filename_string_to_binary,1}|_]) -> 0;
  958: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  959: 	   [{code_server,do_mod_call,4},
  960: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3}|_]) -> 0;
  961: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  962: 	   [{lists,flatmap_1,2},
  963: 	    {lists,flatmap,2},
  964: 	    {lists,concat,1},
  965: 	    {code_server,load_abs,4},
  966: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
  967: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
  968: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  969: 	   [{lists,foreach_1,2},
  970: 	    {lists,foreach,2},
  971: 	    {code_server,stick_dir,3},
  972: 	    {code_server,handle_call,3},
  973: 	    {code_server,loop,1}|_]) -> 0;
  974: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
  975: 	   [{lists,all,2},
  976: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
  977: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
  978: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
  979: 	    {code_server,init,3},
  980: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
  981: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
  982: 	   [{lists,all_1,2},
  983: 	    {lists,all,2},
  984: 	    {code_server,make_path,2},
  985: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs_1,1},
  986: 	    {code_server,get_user_lib_dirs,0},
  987: 	    {code_server,init,3},
  988: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
  989: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
  990: 	   [{lists,filter,2},
  991:         {code_server,store_module_and_reply,3},
  992:         {code_server,handle_loader,4},
  993:         {code_server,run_loader,4},
  994:         {code_server,handle_call,3},
  995:         {code_server,loop,1},
  996:         {code_server,init,3},
  997:         {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
  998: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
  999: 	   [{erlang,apply,2},
 1000: 	    {erlang,spawn_link,1},
 1001: 	    {code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1002: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',_},
 1003: 	   [{erlang,spawn_link,1},{code_server,start_link,1}]) -> 0;
 1004: check_funs({'$M_EXPR',warning_msg,2},
 1005: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_report,2} | _]) -> 0;
 1006: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',1},
 1007: 	   [{code_server,run,2}|_]) -> 0;
 1008: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1009: 	   [{code_server,handle_on_load,5}|_]) -> 0;
 1010: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1011: 	   [{code_server,handle_pending_on_load,4}|_]) -> 0;
 1012: check_funs({'$M_EXPR','$F_EXPR',2},
 1013: 	   [{code_server,finish_on_load_2,3}|_]) -> 0;
 1014: check_funs(This, Path) ->
 1015:     io:format("not_verified(~p, ~p)~n", [This, Path]),
 1016:     1.
 1017: 
 1018: my_usort(List) ->
 1019:     lists:reverse(uniq(lists:sort(List),[])).
 1020: 
 1021: uniq([],A) ->
 1022:     A;
 1023: uniq([H|T],[]) ->
 1024:     uniq(T,[H]);
 1025: uniq([H|T],[H|_]=A) ->
 1026:     uniq(T,A);
 1027: uniq([H|T],A) ->
 1028:     uniq(T,[H|A]).
 1029: 
 1030: 
 1031: where_is_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1032:     {T,KernelBeamFile} = timer:tc(code, where_is_file, ["kernel.beam"]),
 1033:     io:format("Load time: ~w ms~n", [T]),
 1034:     KernelEbinDir = filename:dirname(KernelBeamFile),
 1035:     AppFile = filename:join(KernelEbinDir, "kernel.app"),
 1036:     AppFile = code:where_is_file("kernel.app"),
 1037:     non_existing = code:where_is_file("kernel"), % no such file
 1038:     ok.
 1039: 
 1040: %% Test that stacktrace is deleted when purging a referred module.
 1041: purge_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1042:     run_purge_test(fun purge_stacktrace_test/1, Config).
 1043:     
 1044: purge_stacktrace_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1045:     code:purge(code_b_test),
 1046:     try code_b_test:call(fun(b) -> ok end, a)
 1047:     catch
 1048: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace ->
 1049: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1050: 	    case Stacktrace of
 1051: 		      [{?MODULE,_,[a],_},
 1052: 		       {code_b_test,call,2,_},
 1053: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1054: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1055: 		  end
 1056:     end,
 1057:     try code_b_test:call(nofun, 2)
 1058:     catch
 1059: 	error:function_clause:Stacktrace2 ->
 1060: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1061: 	    case Stacktrace2 of
 1062: 		      [{code_b_test,call,[nofun,2],_},
 1063: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1064: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1065: 		  end
 1066:     end,
 1067:     Args = [erlang,error,[badarg]],
 1068:     try code_b_test:call(erlang, error, [badarg,Args])
 1069:     catch
 1070: 	error:badarg:Stacktrace3 ->
 1071: 	    code:load_file(code_b_test),
 1072: 	    case Stacktrace3 of
 1073: 		      [{code_b_test,call,Args,_},
 1074: 		       {?MODULE,purge_stacktrace_test,1,_}|_] ->
 1075: 			  false = code:purge(code_b_test)
 1076: 		  end
 1077:     end,
 1078:     ok.
 1079: 
 1080: mult_lib_roots(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1081:     DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mult_lib_roots"),
 1082:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-b/ebin/lists"),
 1083: 
 1084:     %% We will use this module to test both code path loading and
 1085:     %% code path caching. So we ensure its beam file does not exist.
 1086:     CodeSuiteMultRootBeam =
 1087: 	filename:join(DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1088:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1089: 
 1090:     %% Set up ERL_LIBS and start a peer node.
 1091:     ErlLibs = filename:join(DataDir, "first_root") ++ mult_lib_sep() ++
 1092: 	filename:join(DataDir, "second_root"),
 1093: 
 1094:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs]),
 1095: 
 1096:     Path0 = rpc:call(Node, code, get_path, []),
 1097:     %% ?CT_PEER adds extra path to this module folder
 1098:     PathToSelf = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1099:     [PathToSelf, "."|Path1] = Path0,
 1100:     [Kernel|Path2] = Path1,
 1101:     [Stdlib|Path3] = Path2,
 1102:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Kernel, "kernel"),
 1103:     mult_lib_verify_lib(Stdlib, "stdlib"),
 1104:     [Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5|Path] = Path3,
 1105: 
 1106: 
 1107:     ["first_root/my_dummy_app-a/ebin",
 1108:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-b/ebin",
 1109:      "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin",
 1110:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-d/ebin",
 1111:      "second_root/my_dummy_app-e/ebin"] =
 1112: 	[mult_lib_remove_prefix(E, DataDir) ||
 1113: 	    E <- lists:sort([Lib1,Lib2,Lib3,Lib4,Lib5])],
 1114:     io:format("~p\n", [Path]),
 1115: 
 1116:     %% Now let's attempt to dynamically add a module,
 1117:     %% this will fail due to the boot paths cache.
 1118:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1119:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1120:     error = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1121:     %% Test that the CWD is not cached
 1122:     File = filename:join([DataDir, "first_root/my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"]),
 1123:     {ok, _} = compile:file(File, [{outdir, "."}]),
 1124:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1125:     true = rpc:call(Node, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1126:     file:delete("code_SUITE_mult_root_module.beam"),
 1127:     %% Clean up so we can start again
 1128:     file:delete(CodeSuiteMultRootBeam),
 1129:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1130: 
 1131:     NoCacheArgs = ["-env", "ERL_LIBS", ErlLibs, "-cache_boot_paths", "false"],
 1132:     {ok, NoCachePeer, NoCacheNode} = ?CT_PEER(NoCacheArgs),
 1133: 
 1134:     %% Now the same code should work
 1135:     error = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1136:     mult_lib_compile(DataDir, "my_dummy_app-c/ebin/code_SUITE_mult_root_module"),
 1137:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code, get_object_code, [code_SUITE_mult_root_module]),
 1138:     true = rpc:call(NoCacheNode, code_SUITE_mult_root_module, works_fine, []),
 1139: 
 1140:     peer:stop(NoCachePeer),
 1141:     ok.
 1142: 
 1143: mult_lib_compile(Root, Last) ->
 1144:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(Last)),
 1145:     Name = filename:join([Root,"first_root",Last]),
 1146:     Dir = filename:dirname(Name),
 1147:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Name, [report,{outdir,Dir}]),
 1148:     ok.
 1149: 
 1150: mult_lib_sep() ->
 1151:     case os:type() of
 1152: 	{win32,_} -> ";";
 1153: 	_ -> ":"
 1154:     end.
 1155: 
 1156: mult_lib_verify_lib(Path, Expected) ->
 1157:     Dir = filename:basename(filename:dirname(Path)),
 1158:     true = lists:prefix(Expected, Dir).
 1159: 
 1160: mult_lib_remove_prefix([H|T1], [H|T2]) ->
 1161:     mult_lib_remove_prefix(T1, T2);
 1162: mult_lib_remove_prefix([$/|T], []) -> T.
 1163: 
 1164: bad_erl_libs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1165:     %% Preserve ERL_LIBS if set.
 1166:     BadLibs0 = "/no/such/dir",
 1167:     BadLibs =
 1168:          case os:getenv("ERL_LIBS") of
 1169:              false -> BadLibs0;
 1170:              Libs -> BadLibs0 ++ ":" ++ Libs
 1171:          end,
 1172:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1173:     Code = rpc:call(Node,code,get_path,[]),
 1174:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1175: 
 1176:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "ERL_LIBS", BadLibs]),
 1177:     Code2 = rpc:call(Node2,code,get_path,[]),
 1178:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1179:     %% Test that code path is not affected by the faulty ERL_LIBS
 1180:     Code = Code2,
 1181: 
 1182:     ok.
 1183: 
 1184: %% Test that a boot file with (almost) all of OTP can be used to start an
 1185: %% embeddedd system.
 1186: big_boot_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1187:     {BootArg,AppsInBoot} = create_big_boot(Config),
 1188:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootArg, "-mode", "embedded"]),
 1189:     RemoteNodeApps =
 1190: 	[ {X,Y} || {X,_,Y} <-
 1191: 		       rpc:call(Node,application,loaded_applications,[]) ],
 1192:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1193:     true = lists:sort(AppsInBoot) =:=  lists:sort(RemoteNodeApps),
 1194:     ok.
 1195: 
 1196: on_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1197:     Master = on_load_test_case_process,
 1198: 
 1199:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load"]),
 1200:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1201:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1202: 
 1203:     %% Register a name for this process.
 1204:     register(Master, self()),
 1205: 
 1206:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1207: 					  exit(on_load_a:data())
 1208: 				  end),
 1209:     receive
 1210: 	{on_load_a,start} -> ok
 1211:     end,
 1212:     receive
 1213: 	{on_load_b,start} -> ok
 1214:     end,
 1215:     receive
 1216: 	{on_load_c,PidC} -> ok
 1217:     end,
 1218: 
 1219:     Refs = on_load_massive_spawn(lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1220:     receive after 7 -> ok end,
 1221: 
 1222:     PidC ! go,
 1223: 
 1224:     KernelLibDir = code:lib_dir(kernel),
 1225:     receive
 1226: 	{on_load_c,done} -> ok
 1227:     end,
 1228:     receive
 1229: 	{on_load_b,done} -> ok
 1230:     end,
 1231:     receive
 1232: 	{on_load_a,KernelLibDir} -> ok
 1233:     end,
 1234: 
 1235:     receive
 1236: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Res} ->
 1237: 	    [a,b,c] = Res
 1238:     end,
 1239: 
 1240:     on_load_wait_for_all(Refs),
 1241:     receive
 1242: 	Any ->
 1243: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
 1244:     after 10 ->
 1245: 	    ok
 1246:     end.
 1247: 
 1248: on_load_massive_spawn([_|T]) ->
 1249:     {_,Ra} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [a,b,c] = on_load_a:data() end),
 1250:     {_,Rb} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [b,c] = on_load_b:data() end),
 1251:     {_,Rc} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> [c] = on_load_c:data() end),
 1252:     [Ra,Rb,Rc|on_load_massive_spawn(T)];
 1253: on_load_massive_spawn([]) -> [].
 1254: 
 1255: on_load_wait_for_all([Ref|T]) ->
 1256:     receive
 1257: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,normal} ->
 1258: 	    on_load_wait_for_all(T)
 1259:     end;
 1260: on_load_wait_for_all([]) -> ok.
 1261: 
 1262: on_load_binary(_) ->
 1263:     Master = on_load_binary_test_case_process,
 1264:     register(Master, self()),
 1265: 
 1266:     %% Construct, compile and pretty-print.
 1267:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1268:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1269:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1270: 	       "-export([ok/0]).\n",
 1271: 	       "-on_load({init,0}).\n",
 1272: 	       "init() ->\n",
 1273: 	       "  '@Master@' ! {on_load_binary,self()},\n",
 1274: 	       "  receive go -> ok end.\n",
 1275: 	       "ok() -> true.\n"]),
 1276:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1277:     merl:print(Tree),
 1278: 
 1279:     {Pid1,Ref1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1280: 					code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1281: 					true = Mod:ok()
 1282: 				end),
 1283:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid} -> ok end,
 1284:     {Pid2,Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1285: 					true = Mod:ok()
 1286: 				end),
 1287:     erlang:yield(),
 1288:     OnLoadPid ! go,
 1289:     receive {'DOWN',Ref1,process,Pid1,Exit1} -> ok end,
 1290:     receive {'DOWN',Ref2,process,Pid2,Exit2} -> ok end,
 1291:     normal = Exit1,
 1292:     normal = Exit2,
 1293:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1294:     false = code:purge(Mod),
 1295:     ok.
 1296: 
 1297: on_load_binary_twice(_) ->
 1298:     Master = on_load_binary_twice_test_case_process,
 1299:     register(Master, self()),
 1300: 
 1301:     %% Construct, compile and pretty-print.
 1302:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1303:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 1304:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1305:            "-export([ok/0]).\n",
 1306:            "-on_load({init,0}).\n",
 1307:            "init() ->\n",
 1308:            "  '@Master@' ! {on_load_binary_twice,self()},\n",
 1309:            "  receive go -> ok end.\n",
 1310:            "ok() -> true.\n"]),
 1311:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1312:     merl:print(Tree),
 1313: 
 1314:     {Pid1,Ref1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1315:                     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1316:                     true = Mod:ok()
 1317:                 end),
 1318:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid1} -> ok end,
 1319:     {Pid2,Ref2} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1320:                     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Bin),
 1321:                     true = Mod:ok()
 1322:                 end),
 1323:     erlang:yield(),
 1324: 
 1325:     OnLoadPid1 ! go,
 1326:     receive {'DOWN',Ref1,process,Pid1,Exit1} -> ok end,
 1327:     normal = Exit1,
 1328: 
 1329:     receive {Mod,OnLoadPid2} -> ok end,
 1330:     OnLoadPid2 ! go,
 1331:     receive {'DOWN',Ref2,process,Pid2,Exit2} -> ok end,
 1332:     normal = Exit2,
 1333: 
 1334:     false = code:purge(Mod),
 1335:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1336:     ok.
 1337: 
 1338: on_load_embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1339:     try
 1340: 	on_load_embedded_1(Config)
 1341:     catch
 1342: 	throw:{skip,_}=Skip ->
 1343: 	    Skip
 1344:     end.
 1345: 
 1346: on_load_embedded_1(Config) ->
 1347:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1348:     LinkName = proplists:get_value(link_name, Config),
 1349: 
 1350:     %% Link the on_load_app application into the lib directory.
 1351:     OnLoadApp = filename:join(DataDir, "on_load_app-1.0"),
 1352:     del_link(LinkName),
 1353:     io:format("LinkName :~p, OnLoadApp: ~p~n",[LinkName,OnLoadApp]),
 1354:     case file:make_symlink(OnLoadApp, LinkName) of
 1355: 	{error,enotsup} ->
 1356: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1357: 	{error,eperm} ->
 1358: 	    %% On Windows, we may not have permissions to create symlinks.
 1359: 	    throw({skip,"Support for symlinks required"});
 1360: 	ok -> ok
 1361:     end,
 1362: 
 1363:     %% Compile the code.
 1364:     OnLoadAppEbin = filename:join(LinkName, "ebin"),
 1365:     {ok,_ } = compile:file(filename:join([OnLoadApp,"src",
 1366: 						"on_load_embedded"]),
 1367: 				 [{outdir,OnLoadAppEbin}]),
 1368: 
 1369:     %% Create and compile a boot file.
 1370:     true = code:add_pathz(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1371:     Options = case is_source_dir() of
 1372: 		  true -> [local];
 1373: 		  false -> []
 1374: 	      end,
 1375:     BootScript = create_boot(Config, Options),
 1376:     true = code:del_path(OnLoadAppEbin),
 1377: 
 1378:     %% Start the node and check that the on_load function was run.
 1379:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-mode", "embedded", "-boot", BootScript]),
 1380:     ok = rpc:call(Node, on_load_embedded, status, []),
 1381: 
 1382:     %% Clean up.
 1383:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1384: 
 1385: del_link(LinkName) ->
 1386:    case file:delete(LinkName) of
 1387:        {error,eperm} ->
 1388:              file:del_dir(LinkName);
 1389:        Other ->
 1390:        	     Other
 1391:    end.
 1392: 
 1393: create_boot(Config, Options) ->
 1394:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1395:     {LatestDir,LatestName} = create_script(Config),
 1396:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1397:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1398:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1399:     filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName).
 1400: 
 1401: create_script(Config) ->
 1402:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1403:     Name = PrivDir ++ "on_load_test",
 1404:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 1405:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel, 1, Apps),
 1406:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib, 1, Apps),
 1407:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1408:     io:format(Fd,
 1409: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1410: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1411: 		    " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"},"
 1412: 		    " {on_load_app, \"1.0\"}]}.\n",
 1413: 		    [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
 1414:     file:close(Fd),
 1415:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name)}.
 1416: 
 1417: create_big_boot(Config) ->
 1418:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
 1419:     {Options,Local} = case is_source_dir() of
 1420: 				true -> {[no_module_tests,local],true};
 1421: 				_ -> {[no_module_tests],false}
 1422: 			    end,
 1423:     {LatestDir,LatestName,Apps} = create_big_script(Config,Local),
 1424:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
 1425:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName, Options),
 1426:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
 1427:     {filename:join(LatestDir, LatestName),Apps}.
 1428: 
 1429: %% The following apps cannot be loaded.
 1430: 
 1431: %% Orber requires explicit configuration
 1432: filter_app("orber",_) -> false;
 1433: 
 1434: %% cos* depends on orber
 1435: filter_app("cos"++_,_) -> false;
 1436: 
 1437: %% ic has a mod instruction in the app file but no corresponding start
 1438: %% function
 1439: filter_app("ic",_) -> false;
 1440: 
 1441: %% Netconf has some dependency that I really do not understand (maybe
 1442: %% like orber)
 1443: filter_app("netconf",_) -> false;
 1444: 
 1445: %% Safe has the same kind of error in the .app file as ic
 1446: filter_app("safe",_) -> false;
 1447: 
 1448: %% Comte cannot be started in the "usual" way
 1449: filter_app("comte",_) -> false;
 1450: 
 1451: %% OS_mon does not find its port program when running cerl
 1452: filter_app("os_mon",true) -> false;
 1453: 
 1454: %% erts is not a "real" app either =/
 1455: filter_app("erts",_) -> false;
 1456: 
 1457: %% wx* depends on that wxwidgets libs
 1458: filter_app("wx"++_,_) -> false;
 1459: 
 1460: %% Other apps should be OK.
 1461: filter_app(_,_) -> true.
 1462: 
 1463: create_big_script(Config,Local) ->
 1464:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1465:     Name = filename:join(PrivDir,"full_script_test"),
 1466:     InitialApplications=application:loaded_applications(),
 1467:     %% Applications left loaded by the application suite, unload them!
 1468:     UnloadFix=[app0,app1,app2,group_leader,app_start_error],
 1469:     [application:unload(Leftover) ||
 1470: 	      Leftover <- UnloadFix,
 1471: 	      lists:keymember(Leftover,1,InitialApplications) ],
 1472:     %% Now we should have only "real" applications...
 1473:     [application:load(list_to_atom(Y))
 1474: 	|| {match,[Y]} <- [re:run(X,code:lib_dir()++"/"++"([^/-]*).*/ebin",
 1475: 		[{capture,[1],list},unicode]) ||
 1476: 	    X <- code:get_path()],filter_app(Y,Local)],
 1477:     Apps = [ {N,V} || {N,_,V} <- application:loaded_applications()],
 1478:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1479:     io:format(Fd,
 1480: 		    "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
 1481: 		    " {erts, \"9.42\"}, \n"
 1482: 		    " ~p}.\n",
 1483: 		    [Apps]),
 1484:     file:close(Fd),
 1485:     NewlyLoaded =
 1486: 	application:loaded_applications() -- InitialApplications,
 1487:     [ application:unload(N) || {N,_,_} <- NewlyLoaded],
 1488:     {filename:dirname(Name),filename:basename(Name),Apps}.
 1489: 
 1490: is_source_dir() ->
 1491:     filename:basename(code:lib_dir(kernel)) =:= "kernel" andalso
 1492: 	filename:basename(code:lib_dir(stdlib)) =:= "stdlib".
 1493: 
 1494: on_load_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1495:     Master = on_load_error_test_case_process,
 1496:     register(Master, self()),
 1497: 
 1498:     Data = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),"on_load_errors"]),
 1499:     ok = file:set_cwd(Data),
 1500:     up_to_date = make:all([{d,'MASTER',Master}]),
 1501: 
 1502:     do_on_load_error(an_atom),
 1503: 
 1504:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 1505: 
 1506:     do_on_load_error({something,terrible,is,wrong}),
 1507:     receive
 1508: 	Any1 ->
 1509: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1510: 		   [on_load_error,
 1511: 		    {something,terrible,is,wrong},_]} = Any1
 1512:     end,
 1513: 
 1514:     do_on_load_error(fail),		%Cause exception.
 1515:     receive
 1516: 	Any2 ->
 1517: 	    {_, "The on_load function"++_,
 1518: 		   [on_load_error,{failed,[_|_]},_]} = Any2
 1519:     end,
 1520: 
 1521:     %% There should be no more messages.
 1522:     receive
 1523: 	Unexpected ->
 1524: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1525:     after 10 ->
 1526: 	    ok
 1527:     end,
 1528: 
 1529:     %% Make sure that the code loading functions return the correct
 1530:     %% error code.
 1531:     Simple = simple_on_load_error,
 1532:     SimpleList = atom_to_list(Simple),
 1533:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_file(Simple),
 1534:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:ensure_loaded(Simple),
 1535:     {ok,SimpleCode} = file:read_file("simple_on_load_error.beam"),
 1536:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Simple, "", SimpleCode),
 1537:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList),
 1538:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_abs(SimpleList, Simple),
 1539: 
 1540:     ok.
 1541: 
 1542: do_on_load_error(ReturnValue) ->
 1543:     {_,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1544: 					  exit(on_load_error:main())
 1545: 				  end),
 1546:     receive {on_load_error,ErrorPid} -> ok end,
 1547:     ErrorPid ! ReturnValue,
 1548:     receive
 1549: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,_,Exit} ->
 1550: 	    {undef,[{on_load_error,main,[],_}|_]} = Exit
 1551:     end.
 1552: 
 1553: on_load_update(Config) ->
 1554:     {Mod,Code1} = on_load_update_code(1),
 1555:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1556:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1557:     100 = Mod:b(99),
 1558:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, true),
 1559: 
 1560:     {Mod,Code2} = on_load_update_code(2),
 1561:     {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1562:     42 = Mod:a(),
 1563:     78 = Mod:b(77),
 1564:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1565:     4 = erlang:trace_pattern({Mod,'_','_'}, false),
 1566: 
 1567:     {Mod,Code3} = on_load_update_code(3),
 1568:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code3),
 1569:     100 = Mod:c(),
 1570:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:a()),
 1571:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:b(10)),
 1572:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Mod:never()),
 1573: 
 1574:     code:purge(Mod),
 1575:     code:delete(Mod),
 1576:     code:purge(Mod),
 1577:     ok.
 1578: 
 1579: on_load_update_code(Version) ->
 1580:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1581:     Tree = on_load_update_code_1(Version, Mod),
 1582:     io:format("Version ~p", [Version]),
 1583:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1584:     merl:print(Tree),
 1585:     io:nl(),
 1586:     {Mod,Code}.
 1587: 
 1588: on_load_update_code_1(1, Mod) ->
 1589:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1590: 	"-export([a/0,b/1]).\n"
 1591: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1592: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1593: 	"a() -> 42.\n"
 1594: 	"b(I) -> I+1.\n"]);
 1595: on_load_update_code_1(2, Mod) ->
 1596:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1597: 	"-export([never/0]).\n"
 1598: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1599: 	"f() -> 42 = '@Mod@':a(), 1 = '@Mod@':b(0), fail.\n",
 1600: 	"never() -> never.\n"]);
 1601: on_load_update_code_1(3, Mod) ->
 1602:     ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1603: 	"-export([c/0]).\n"
 1604: 	"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1605: 	"f() -> ok.\n",
 1606: 	"c() -> 100.\n"]).
 1607: 
 1608: %% Test -on_load while trace feature 'on_load' is enabled (OTP-14612)
 1609: on_load_trace_on_load(Config) ->
 1610:     %% 'on_load' enables tracing for all newly loaded modules, so we make a dry
 1611:     %% run to ensure that ancillary modules like 'merl' won't be loaded during
 1612:     %% the actual test.
 1613:     on_load_update(Config),
 1614: 
 1615:     Papa = self(),
 1616:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun F() -> receive M -> Papa ! M end, F() end),
 1617:     {tracer,[]} = erlang:trace_info(self(),tracer),
 1618:     erlang:trace(self(), true, [call, {tracer, Tracer}]),
 1619:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, true, []),
 1620:     on_load_update(Config),
 1621:     erlang:trace_pattern(on_load, false, []),
 1622:     erlang:trace(self(), false, [call]),
 1623: 
 1624:     Ms = flush(),
 1625:     [{trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, a, []}},
 1626:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, b, [99]}},
 1627:      {trace, Papa, call, {on_load_update_code, c, []}}] = Ms,
 1628: 
 1629:     exit(Tracer, normal),
 1630:     ok.
 1631: 
 1632: flush() ->
 1633:     receive M -> [M | flush()]
 1634:     after 100 -> []
 1635:     end.
 1636: 
 1637: on_load_purge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1638:     run_purge_test(fun on_load_purge_test/1, Config).
 1639: 
 1640: on_load_purge_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1641:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1642:     register(Mod, self()),
 1643:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1644: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1645: 	       "loop() -> loop().\n",
 1646: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1647: 	       "'@Mod@' ! {self(),spawn(fun loop/0)},\n",
 1648: 	       "receive Ack -> Ack end.\n"]),
 1649:     merl:print(Tree),
 1650:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1651:     P = spawn(fun() ->
 1652: 		      exit(code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code))
 1653: 	      end),
 1654:     monitor(process, P),
 1655:     receive
 1656: 	{Pid1,Pid2} ->
 1657: 	    monitor(process, Pid2),
 1658: 	    Pid1 ! ack_and_failure,
 1659: 	    receive
 1660: 		{'DOWN',_,process,P,Exit1} ->
 1661: 		    {error,on_load_failure} = Exit1
 1662: 	    end,
 1663: 	    receive
 1664: 		{'DOWN',_,process,Pid2,Exit2} ->
 1665: 		    io:format("~p\n", [Exit2])
 1666: 	    after 10000 ->
 1667: 		    ct:fail(no_down_message)
 1668: 	    end
 1669:     end,
 1670:     unregister(Mod),
 1671:     ok.
 1672: 
 1673: on_load_self_call(_Config) ->
 1674:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1675:     register(Mod, self()),
 1676:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1677: 	       "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1678: 	       "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1679: 	       "f() ->\n",
 1680: 	       "  '@Mod@' ! (catch '@Mod@':ext()),\n",
 1681: 	       "  ok.\n",
 1682: 	       "ext() -> good_work.\n"]),
 1683:         merl:print(Tree),
 1684:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1685: 
 1686:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1687:     good_work = on_load_do_load(Mod, Code),
 1688: 
 1689:     ok.
 1690: 
 1691: on_load_do_load(Mod, Code) ->
 1692:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1693:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1694:                end),
 1695:     receive
 1696: 	Any -> Any
 1697:     end.
 1698: 
 1699: on_load_pending(_Config) ->
 1700:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1701:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1702: 		"-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1703: 		"f() ->\n",
 1704: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1705: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1706:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1707:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1708: 
 1709:     Tree2 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1710: 		"-export([t/0]).\n",
 1711: 		"t() -> ok.\n"]),
 1712:     merl:print(Tree2),
 1713:     {ok,Mod,Code2} = merl:compile(Tree2),
 1714: 
 1715:     Self = self(),
 1716:     {_,Ref1} =
 1717: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1718: 			      Self ! started1,
 1719: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1)
 1720: 		      end),
 1721:     receive started1 -> ok end,
 1722:     timer:sleep(10),
 1723:     {_,Ref2} =
 1724: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1725: 			      Self ! started2,
 1726: 			      {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code2),
 1727: 			      ok = Mod:t()
 1728: 		      end),
 1729:     receive started2 -> ok end,
 1730:     receive
 1731: 	Unexpected ->
 1732: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Unexpected})
 1733:     after 100 ->
 1734: 	    ok
 1735:     end,
 1736:     Mod ! go,
 1737:     receive
 1738: 	{'DOWN',Ref1,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1739:     end,
 1740:     receive
 1741: 	{'DOWN',Ref2,process,_,normal} -> ok
 1742:     end,
 1743:     ok = Mod:t(),
 1744:     ok.
 1745: 
 1746: on_load_deleted(_Config) ->
 1747:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1748: 
 1749:     R0 = fun() ->
 1750: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1751: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1752: 			    "f() -> ok.\n"]),
 1753: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1754: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1755: 		 {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1756: 	 end,
 1757:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1758:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R0),
 1759: 
 1760:     R1 = fun() ->
 1761: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1762: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1763: 			    "f() -> fail.\n"]),
 1764: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1765: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1766: 		 {error,on_load_failure} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1767: 	 end,
 1768:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1769:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R1),
 1770: 
 1771:     OtherMod = list_to_atom(lists:concat([Mod,"_42"])),
 1772:     OtherTree = ?Q(["-module('@OtherMod@').\n"]),
 1773:     merl:print(OtherTree),
 1774:     {ok,OtherMod,OtherCode} = merl:compile(OtherTree),
 1775: 
 1776:     R2 = fun() ->
 1777: 		 RegName = 'on_load__registered_name',
 1778: 		 Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1779: 			    "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1780: 			    "f() ->\n",
 1781: 			    "  register('@RegName@', self()),\n",
 1782: 			    "  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1783: 		 merl:print(Tree),
 1784: 		 {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1785: 		 spawn_link(fun() ->
 1786:                                     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code)
 1787:                             end),
 1788: 		 receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1789: 		 {module,OtherMod} = code:load_binary(OtherMod, "",
 1790: 						      OtherCode),
 1791: 		 RegName ! stop
 1792: 	 end,
 1793:     delete_before_reload(Mod, R2),
 1794: 
 1795:     ok.
 1796: 
 1797: on_load_deadlock(Config) ->
 1798:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1799:     register(Mod, self()),
 1800:     Tree = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1801:                "-export([ext/0]).\n",
 1802:                "-on_load(f/0).\n",
 1803:                "f() ->\n",
 1804:                "  timer:sleep(1000),\n",
 1805:                "  '@Mod@':ext().\n",
 1806:                "ext() -> ok.\n"]),
 1807:     merl:print(Tree),
 1808:     {ok,Mod,Code} = merl:compile(Tree),
 1809: 
 1810:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1811:     File = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam"),
 1812:     ok = file:write_file(File, Code),
 1813:     code:add_path(Dir),
 1814: 
 1815:     spawn(fun() -> code:ensure_loaded(Mod) end),
 1816:     {error,Reason} = code:ensure_loaded(Mod),
 1817:     true = (Reason =:= deadlock) or (Reason =:= on_load_failure),
 1818: 
 1819:     code:del_path(Dir),
 1820:     ok.
 1821: 
 1822: on_load_deadlock_load_binary_GH7466(Config) ->
 1823:     Tree = ?Q(["-module(foo).\n",
 1824:                "-on_load(init_module/0).\n",
 1825:                "-export([bar/0]).\n",
 1826:                "bar() -> ok.\n",
 1827:                "init_module() ->\n",
 1828:                "    timer:sleep(1000).\n"]),
 1829:     merl:print(Tree),
 1830: 
 1831:     %% Compiles the form, does not load binary
 1832:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Tree),
 1833:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1834:     File = filename:join(Dir, "foo.beam"),
 1835:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 1836:     code:add_path(Dir),
 1837: 
 1838:     Self = self(),
 1839:     LoadBin = fun() ->
 1840:                       _ = code:load_binary(Mod, "foo.beam", Bin),
 1841:                       Self ! {done, self()},
 1842:                       Self
 1843:               end,
 1844:     %% this deadlocks in OTP-26
 1845:     PidX = spawn(LoadBin),
 1846:     PidY = spawn(LoadBin),
 1847:     Self = LoadBin(),
 1848:     ok = receiver(PidX),
 1849:     ok = receiver(PidY),
 1850:     ok = receiver(Self),
 1851: 
 1852:     code:del_path(Dir),
 1853:     ok.
 1854: 
 1855: on_load_deadlock_ensure_loaded_GH7466(Config) ->
 1856:     Tree = ?Q(["-module(foo).\n",
 1857:                "-on_load(init_module/0).\n",
 1858:                "-export([bar/0]).\n",
 1859:                "bar() -> ok.\n",
 1860:                "init_module() ->\n",
 1861:                "    timer:sleep(1000), bar().\n"]),
 1862:     _ = merl:print(Tree),
 1863: 
 1864:     %% Compiles the form, does not load binary
 1865:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Tree),
 1866:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1867:     File = filename:join(Dir, "foo.beam"),
 1868:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 1869:     code:add_path(Dir),
 1870: 
 1871:     Self = self(),
 1872:     EnsureLoaded = fun() ->
 1873:                            _ = code:ensure_loaded(Mod),
 1874:                            Self ! {done, self()},
 1875:                            Self
 1876:                    end,
 1877:     Pid = spawn(EnsureLoaded),
 1878:     Pid2 = spawn(EnsureLoaded),
 1879:     Self = EnsureLoaded(),
 1880:     ok = receiver(Pid),
 1881:     ok = receiver(Pid2),
 1882:     ok = receiver(Self),
 1883: 
 1884:     code:del_path(Dir),
 1885:     ok.
 1886: 
 1887: receiver(Pid) ->
 1888:     receive
 1889:         {done, Pid} -> ok
 1890:     after 10_000 ->
 1891:             it_deadlocked
 1892:     end.
 1893: 
 1894: delete_before_reload(Mod, Reload) ->
 1895:     false = check_old_code(Mod),
 1896: 
 1897:     Tree1 = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n",
 1898: 		"-export([f/1]).\n",
 1899: 		"f(Parent) ->\n",
 1900: 		"  register('@Mod@', self()),\n",
 1901: 		"  Parent ! started,\n",
 1902: 		"  receive _ -> ok end.\n"]),
 1903:     merl:print(Tree1),
 1904:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = merl:compile(Tree1),
 1905: 
 1906:     Self = self(),
 1907:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1908:                        {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Code1),
 1909:                        Mod:f(Self)
 1910:                end),
 1911:     receive started -> ok end,
 1912: 
 1913:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1914:     true = check_old_code(Mod),
 1915: 
 1916:     Reload(),
 1917: 
 1918:     %% When loading the the module with the -on_load() function,
 1919:     %% the reference to the old code would be lost. Make sure that
 1920:     %% the old code is remembered and is still preventing the
 1921:     %% purge.
 1922:     false = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1923: 
 1924:     %% Get rid of the old code.
 1925:     Mod ! stop,
 1926:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
 1927:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1928: 
 1929:     %% Unload the version of the module with the -on_load() function.
 1930:     true = code:delete(Mod),
 1931:     true = code:soft_purge(Mod),
 1932: 
 1933:     ok.
 1934: 
 1935: %% Test that the mode of the code server is properly retrieved.
 1936: get_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1937:     interactive = code:get_mode().
 1938: 
 1939: %% Make sure that the paths for all loaded modules have been normalized.
 1940: normalized_paths(_Config) ->
 1941:     do_normalized_paths(erlang:loaded()).
 1942: 
 1943: do_normalized_paths([M|Ms]) ->
 1944:     case code:which(M) of
 1945: 	Special when is_atom(Special) ->
 1946: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms);
 1947: 	File when is_list(File) ->
 1948: 	    File = filename:join([File]),
 1949: 	    do_normalized_paths(Ms)
 1950:     end;
 1951: do_normalized_paths([]) ->
 1952:     ok.
 1953: 
 1954: %% Make sure that the extra -mode flags are ignored
 1955: mult_embedded_flags(_Config) ->
 1956:     Modes = [{["-mode", "embedded"], embedded},
 1957: 	     {["-mode", "interactive"], interactive},
 1958: 	     {["-mode", "invalid"], interactive}],
 1959: 
 1960:     [ begin
 1961: 	  {ArgMode, ExpectedMode} = Mode,
 1962: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgMode),
 1963: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 1964: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 1965:       end || Mode <- Modes],
 1966: 
 1967:     [ begin
 1968: 	  {ArgIgnoredMode, _} = IgnoredMode,
 1969: 	  {ArgRelevantMode, ExpectedMode} = RelevantMode,
 1970: 	  {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(ArgRelevantMode ++ ArgIgnoredMode),
 1971: 	  ExpectedMode = rpc:call(Node, code, get_mode, []),
 1972: 	  peer:stop(Peer)
 1973:       end || IgnoredMode <- Modes, RelevantMode <- Modes],
 1974:     ok.
 1975: 
 1976: %% Test that module_status/1 behaves as expected
 1977: module_status(_Config) ->
 1978:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1979:         true ->
 1980:             module_status();
 1981:         false ->
 1982:             %% Make sure that we terminate the cover server.
 1983:             try
 1984:                 module_status()
 1985:             after
 1986:                 cover:stop()
 1987:             end
 1988:     end.
 1989: 
 1990: module_status() ->
 1991:     %% basics
 1992:     not_loaded = code:module_status(fubar),     % nonexisting
 1993:     {file, preloaded} = code:is_loaded(erlang),
 1994:     loaded = code:module_status(erlang),        % preloaded
 1995:     loaded = code:module_status(?MODULE),       % normal known loaded
 1996: 
 1997:     %% module_status/0 returns status for each loaded module
 1998:     true = (lists:sort([{M, code:module_status(M)}
 1999:                         || {M, _} <- code:all_loaded()])
 2000:             =:= lists:sort(code:module_status())),
 2001: 
 2002:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify dummy name not in path
 2003:     code:purge(?TESTMOD), % ensure no previous version in memory
 2004:     code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2005:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2006: 
 2007:     %% generated code is detected as such
 2008:     {ok,?TESTMOD,Bin} = compile:forms(dummy_ast(), []),
 2009:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_binary(?TESTMOD,"",Bin),  % no source file
 2010:     ok = ?TESTMOD:f(),
 2011:     "" = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify empty string for source file
 2012:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2013: 
 2014:     %% module_status/1 also accepts a list of modules
 2015:     [] = code:module_status([]),
 2016:     [{erlang, loaded},{?MODULE,loaded},{?TESTMOD,loaded}] =
 2017:         code:module_status([erlang, ?MODULE, ?TESTMOD]),
 2018: 
 2019:     %% deleting generated code
 2020:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2021:     non_existing = code:which(?TESTMOD), % verify still not in path
 2022:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2023: 
 2024:     %% beam file exists but not loaded
 2025:     make_source_file(<<"0">>),
 2026:     compile_beam(0),
 2027:     true = (non_existing =/= code:which(?TESTMOD)), % verify in path
 2028:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2029: 
 2030:     %% loading code from disk makes it loaded
 2031:     load_code(),
 2032:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded
 2033: 
 2034:     %% cover compiling a module
 2035:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = cover:compile(?TESTMOD),
 2036:     {file, cover_compiled} = code:is_loaded(?TESTMOD), % verify cover compiled
 2037:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loaded cover code but file exists
 2038:     remove_code(),
 2039:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % removed
 2040:     compile_beam(0),
 2041:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % recreated
 2042:     load_code(),
 2043:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % loading removes cover status
 2044:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2045:     true = code:delete(?TESTMOD),
 2046:     not_loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD), % deleted
 2047: 
 2048:     %% recompilation ignores timestamps, only md5 matters
 2049:     load_code(),
 2050:     compile_beam(1100),
 2051:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2052: 
 2053:     %% modifying module detects different md5
 2054:     make_source_file(<<"1">>),
 2055:     compile_beam(0),
 2056:     modified = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2057: 
 2058:     %% loading the modified code from disk makes it loaded
 2059:     load_code(),
 2060:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2061: 
 2062:     %% removing and recreating a module with same md5
 2063:     remove_code(),
 2064:     removed = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2065:     compile_beam(0),
 2066:     loaded = code:module_status(?TESTMOD),
 2067: 
 2068:     ok.
 2069: 
 2070: compile_beam(Sleep) ->
 2071:     compile(Sleep, []).
 2072: 
 2073: compile(Sleep, Opts) ->
 2074:     timer:sleep(Sleep),  % increment compilation timestamp
 2075:     {ok,?TESTMOD} = compile:file(?TESTMODSRC, Opts).
 2076: 
 2077: load_code() ->
 2078:     code:purge(?TESTMOD),
 2079:     {module,?TESTMOD} = code:load_file(?TESTMOD).
 2080: 
 2081: remove_code() ->
 2082:     ok = file:delete(?TESTMODOBJ).
 2083: 
 2084: make_source_file(Body) ->
 2085:     ok = file:write_file(?TESTMODSRC, dummy_source(Body)).
 2086: 
 2087: dummy_source(Body) ->
 2088:     [<<"-module(" ?TESTMODSTR ").\n"
 2089:        "-export([f/0]).\n"
 2090:        "f() -> ">>, Body, <<".\n">>].
 2091: 
 2092: dummy_ast() ->
 2093:     dummy_ast(?TESTMODSTR).
 2094: 
 2095: dummy_ast(Mod) when is_atom(Mod) ->
 2096:     dummy_ast(atom_to_list(Mod));
 2097: dummy_ast(ModStr) ->
 2098:     [scan_form("-module(" ++ ModStr ++ ")."),
 2099:      scan_form("-export([f/0])."),
 2100:      scan_form("f() -> ok.")].
 2101: 
 2102: scan_form(String) ->
 2103:     {ok,Ts,_} = erl_scan:string(String),
 2104:     {ok,F} = erl_parse:parse_form(Ts),
 2105:     F.
 2106: 
 2107: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2108: %% error_logger handler.
 2109: %% (Copied from stdlib/test/proc_lib_SUITE.erl.)
 2110: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2111: init(Tester) ->
 2112:     {ok, Tester}.
 2113: 
 2114: handle_event({warning_msg, _GL, Msg}, Tester) ->
 2115:     Tester ! Msg,
 2116:     {ok, Tester};
 2117: handle_event(_Event, State) ->
 2118:     {ok, State}.
 2119: 
 2120: handle_info(_, State) ->
 2121:     {ok, State}.
 2122: 
 2123: handle_call(_Query, State) -> {ok, {error, bad_query}, State}.
 2124: 
 2125: terminate(_Reason, State) ->
 2126:     State.
 2127: 
 2128: %%%
 2129: %%% Common utility functions.
 2130: %%%
 2131: 
 2132: run_purge_test(Test, Config) ->
 2133:     OSRL = erlang:system_info(outstanding_system_requests_limit),
 2134:     
 2135:     TestLowOSRL = case OSRL < 10 of
 2136:                       true -> 1;
 2137:                       false -> 5
 2138:                   end,
 2139: 
 2140:     io:format("Running with the default outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [OSRL]),
 2141:     Res1 = Test(Config),
 2142:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res1]),
 2143:     try
 2144:         %% Run again with low limit and many processes...
 2145:         Procs = case erlang:system_info(process_limit) of
 2146:                     PLim when PLim < 20000 ->
 2147:                         erlang:system_info(process_limit) div 2;
 2148:                     _ ->
 2149:                         10000
 2150:                 end,
 2151:         erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, TestLowOSRL),
 2152:         io:format("Running with outstanding request limit of ~p~n", [TestLowOSRL]),
 2153:         Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2154:                                spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end)
 2155:                        end, lists:seq(1, Procs)),
 2156:         Res2 = Test(Config),
 2157:         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 2158:                               unlink(P),
 2159:                               exit(P, kill)
 2160:                       end, Ps),
 2161:         lists:foreach(fun (P) -> is_process_alive(P) end, Ps),
 2162:         io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Res2]),
 2163:         {Res1, Res2}
 2164:     after
 2165:         TestLowOSRL = erlang:system_flag(outstanding_system_requests_limit, OSRL)
 2166:     end.
